name: Erdős–Straus conjecture
summary: The Erdős–Straus conjecture is an unproven statement in number theory that proposes that for every integer \(n\ge 2\), the fraction \(4/n\) can be expressed as the sum of three unit fractions, meaning there exist positive integers \(x\), \(y\), and \(z\) such that:\(\frac{4}{n}=\frac{1}{x}+\frac{1}{y}+\frac{1}{z}\)
head: \(n\) is an integer such that \(n\ge 2\)
tail: there exist positive integers \(x,y,\) and \(z\) such that the equation \(\frac{4}{n}=\frac{1}{x}+\frac{1}{y}+\frac{1}{z}\) holds.
